Viral Banjir di Banding karena Kasur, Satgas Citarum Harum Ungkap Fakta Soal Sampah Besar
05 Nov 2019, 05:39 by Tim Pikiran Rakyat
BANDUNG, (PR).- Salah satu kawasan di Kota Bandung yang kerap dilanda banjir adalah kawasan Pagarsih dan Pasirkoja. Meski sudah ada tol air di Pagarsih, banjir masih terjadi di dua kawasan yang berdekatan tersebut. Pada Jumat 1 November 2019, banjir melanda dua kawasan itu.
DPU (Dinas Pekerjaan Umum) Kota Bandung berusaha mencari penyebab banjir di kawasan tersebut. Pada Senin 4 November 2019, penyebabnya diketahui.
Kasur bekas menjadi penyebabnya banjir di dua kawasan tersebut. DPU Kota Bandung melaporkan, selain tumpukan sampah plastik yang menghambat aliran air, kasur bekas yang dibuang warga membuat aliran air tersendat.
"Dari mana datangnya banjir di Gang Pasantren, Pasirkoja? Ternyata ini penyebabnya," kata DPU Kota Bandung dalam keterangan foto penemuan kasur bekas di Pasirkoja via akun media soaial.
Dari kasur hingga kulkas
Sementara itu Komandan Sektor 22 Satgas Citarum Harum, Kolonel Inf. Asep Rahman Taufik membenarkan bahwa warga Kota Bandung masih banyak yang membuang sampah dan barang bekas ke sungai. Perabot rumah tangga bekas kerap ditemukan Satgas Citarum Harum di beberapa sungai di Kota Bandung.
"Kami sudah beberapa kali menemukan kasur. Kami menemukan lemari bekas, kursi bekas, sofa, dan lainnya. Banyak sekali ditemukan di anak sungai di Kota Bandung," ujar Asep alam wawancara yang disiarkan Radio PRFM, Senin 4 November 2019.
"Apabila hujan lebat, di beberapa titik terjadi terjadi banjir, disebabkan tumpukan sampah yang setiap hari masih ada karena masyarakat masih banyak yang buang sampah ke sungai," ucap Asep.



Selain sampahdi beberapa titik di Kota Bandung, aliran sungai mengalami penyempitan. Pasalnya, banyak rumah warga yang dibangun di bantaran sungai.
"Tapi banjir ini tidak lama, tidak sampai sejam setelah hujan reda, banjir sudah tidak ada," ujarnya.
Sebagai langkah antisipasi banjir, beberapa waktu lalu, Pemerintah Kota Bandung menggelar program Mapag Hujan. Program itu merupakan program yang digelar untuk membersihkan sungai-sungai yang da di Kota Bandung.
Dalam program Mapag Hujan, Satgas Citarum Harum ikut serta. Masih saja banyak ditemukan di sungai karena masih banyaknya warga yang buang sampah ke sungai.
"Alhamdulillah sampah yang terangkut (saat Mapag Hujan) cukup banyak, tapi kesadaran masyarakat untuk tidak buang sampah (ke sungai) belum tuntas karena masih banyak sampah di sungai," ujar Asep.
Lebih parahnya, Asep bercerita, sampah yang ditemukan di sungai bukan hanya sampah plastik. Selain botol plastik dan plastik makanan ringan, kasur ditemukan mengambang di aliran sungai.
Asep meminta warga tidak membuang sampah lagi ke sungai. Terlebih, kini Dinas Lingkungan Hidup dan Kebersihan Kota Bandung telah membuat program Jemput Sampah agar warga tidak membuang sampah besar seperti kasur dan lemari es ke sungai.
Asep mengatakan, dia juga telah menindak 140 orang yang tertangkap tangan membuang sampah ke sungai. Atas perbuatannya, mereka diberi sanksi sosial selama 14 hari.***

Viral Flood in Appeals because of Mattress, Citarum Fragrant Task Force Reveals Facts About Large Trash Problem
05 Nov 2019, 05:39 by The People's Mind Team
BANDUNG, (PR) .- One of the areas in Bandung that is often hit by floods is the Pagarsih and Pasirkoja areas. Although there is already a water toll in Pagarsih, flooding still occurs in the two adjacent areas. On Friday 1 November 2019, floods struck the two regions.
DPU (Public Works Department) of Bandung City is trying to find the cause of flooding in the area. On Monday 4 November 2019, the cause was known.
Used mattresses are the cause of flooding in these two areas. Bandung City DPU reports, in addition to a pile of plastic waste that obstructs the flow of water, used mattresses thrown by residents make the water flow hiccup.
"Where did the flooding come from in the Pasantren Alley, Pasirkoja? This turned out to be the cause," said the Bandung City DPU in a description of the discovery of used mattresses in Pasirkoja via social media accounts.
From the mattress to the refrigerator
Meanwhile the Commander of Sector 22 Citarum Harum Task Force, Col. Inf. Asep Rahman Taufik confirmed that many residents of Bandung City still throw garbage and used goods into the river. Used household furniture is often found by the Citarum Harum Task Force in several rivers in the city of Bandung.
"We have found mattresses several times. We found used cabinets, used chairs, sofas, and many more. Many were found in tributaries in the city of Bandung," Asep said in an interview broadcast by Radio PRFM, Monday 4 November 2019.
"When heavy rains occur, at some point floods occur, due to piles of rubbish that still exist every day because there are still many people who throw garbage into rivers," Asep said.



In addition to garbage at several points in the city of Bandung, the river flow has narrowed. Because, many residents' homes were built on the banks of the river.
"But this flood did not last long, not until an hour after the rain stopped, the flood was gone," he said.
In anticipation of flooding, some time ago, the Bandung City Government held the Mapag Rain program. The program is a program that is held to clean up rivers that are in the city of Bandung.
In the Rain Mapag program, the Citarum Harum Task Force participated. There are still many found in the river because there are still many people who throw garbage into the river.
"Thank God, the garbage that was transported (when Mapag Rained) was quite a lot, but public awareness to not throw garbage (into the river) has not been completed because there is still a lot of garbage in the river," said Asep.
Even worse, Asep said, the garbage found in the river is not just plastic waste. In addition to plastic bottles and plastic snacks, mattresses were found floating in streams.
Asep asked residents not to throw garbage into the river anymore. Moreover, now the Department of Environment and Cleanliness of the City of Bandung has created a Garbage Pick Up program so that residents do not throw large waste such as mattresses and refrigerators into the river.
Asep said he had also cracked down on 140 people who were caught in the act of dumping garbage into the river. For their actions, they were given social sanctions for 14 days. ***
